result.execSummary:
The defendant Jonathan M Meyer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Intentionally Cause Harm [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(2)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
*Not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
*Not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program
Concurrent with: Concurrent with sentence currently being served

superMiscConds.notes:
*Comply with the conditions of his previous sentence
*Complete any other treatment or counseling as recommended by the agent, including domestic violence treatment
*No contact with the victim, Nicole Copley, unless she consents and the agent consents
*No contact with the child, unless the child consents and the agent consents

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jonathan M Meyer in court with attorney Anne Renc. Defendant Jonathan M Meyer in custody. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

8:40 am  Case is called.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: No Contest

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty of Count 2.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 1 - Dismissed and read-in

Atty Renc agrees to repeater.

State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Renc makes sentencing arguments to the Court and requests the warrant be quashed.

BY THE COURT:
Warrant is quashed.

Count 2:
Serve determinate sentence of 4 years in the Wisconsin State Prison System.
2 years Initial Confinement followed by 2 years Extended Supervision.
Concurrent to sentence currently serving.
Not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Not eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
7 days jail credit
Conditions of Extended Supervision:
Comply with the conditions of his previous sentence.
Complete any other treatment or counseling recommended by the agent, including domestic violence treatment.
No contact with the victim Nicole Copley, unless she consents and the agent consents.
No contact with the child, unless the child consents and the agent consents.

Court provides Defendant with Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.
Ad Prosequendum with attached Writ of Habeas Corpus Ad Prosequendum /s/ TBE 09/05/17
